pull.title: wallet: Introduce assertion to document the assumption that cache and cache_used are always set in tandem
pull.body:
Avoid potential null pointer dereference in `CWalletTx::GetAvailableCredit(...)`.

Introduced in 4279da47855ec776f8d57c6579fe89afc9cbe8c1.

events.message: wallet: Avoid potential null pointer dereference in CWalletTx::GetAvailableCredit(...)

events.body:
So is an assert acceptable here?
When can this happen? Is it acceptable for the process to crash when it happens, or would this need actual error handling?
utACK d06330396f64b9a3a3016afc1f937633b4b322ab. They are always set in tandem. Though, there is no "potential null pointer dereference", please adjust the title.

rename.from: wallet: Avoid potential null pointer dereference in CWalletTx::GetAvailableCredit(...)
rename.to: wallet: Introduce assertion to document the assumption that cache and cache_used are always set in tandem

events.body: @MarcoFalke Thanks for the review and the utACK. Title now updated :-)

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
tests: fixes mininode's P2PConnection sending messages on closing transport
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13715

depends: disable Werror when building zmq
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13689

[trivial] Correct help text for `importaddress` RPC
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13074

wallet: Fix non-determinism in ParseHDKeypath(...). Avoid using an uninitialized variable in path calculation.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13712

Add createwallet "disableprivatekeys" option: a sane mode for watchonly-wallets
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9662

docs: Specify preferred Python string formatting technique
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13718

p2p: Remove dead service bits code
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11637

lint: Add linter for circular dependencies
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13695

Remove boost::program_options dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13482

Fix bitcoin-cli --version
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13725

Utils and libraries: Removes the boost/algorithm/string/join dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13726

wallet: Introduce assertion to document the assumption that cache and cache_used are always set in tandem
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683

trivial: Replace CPubKey::operator[] with CPubKey::vch where possible
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13722

Remove redundant variables, statements and forward declarations
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13691

doc: Remove field in getblocktemplate help that has never been used.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12764

Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11762

Utils: Refactor ArgsManager a little
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13733

Drop dead code from Stacks
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13633

Net: Fixed a race condition when disabling the network.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13212

trivial: remove unneeded include
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13740

Avoid creating a temporary vector for size-prefixed elements
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13719

tests: Skip P2PConnection's is_closing() check when not available
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13747

issue.title: Backports from Bitcoin
issue.body:
We recently investigated the Bitcoin issues which are related to privacy protection, vulnerability patches, or security enhancements. We have also checked the `repoName` source code. Results show that these issues and their PRs are not backported yet. Henceforth, we suggest that `repoName` should backport the PRs listed below for the considerations of software security and integrity. 

- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#17906](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17906), avoid uninitialized reads.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#16572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16572), fix a `Char` variable used as `Bool`.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#15039](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15039), avoid leaking `nLockTime` fingerprint.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#14993](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993), fix data race in `InterruptRPC()`.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13808](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13808), shuffle coins before grouping, for privacy protection.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13683](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683), avoid potential null pointer dereference.

Some of these issues and PRs are not severe security-related, but backports can avoid the chaos ecosystem of Bitcoin-forked projects and the potential vulnerabilities in the future. 

Reported by `de957ad9679f28a38f02f00cc7928bce8fb424882ff060a3c09c32895b1474cc`.

issue.title: Backports from Bitcoin
issue.body:
We recently investigated the Bitcoin issues which are related to privacy protection, vulnerability patches, or security enhancements. We have also checked the `repoName` source code. Results show that these issues and their PRs are not backported yet. Henceforth, we suggest that `repoName` should backport the PRs listed below for the considerations of software security and integrity. 

- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#17906](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17906), avoid uninitialized reads.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#16572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16572), fix a `Char` variable used as `Bool`.

Some of these issues and PRs are not severe security-related, but backports can avoid the chaos ecosystem of Bitcoin-forked projects and the potential vulnerabilities in the future.

issue.title: Backports from Bitcoin
issue.body:
We recently investigated the Bitcoin issues which are related to privacy protection, vulnerability patches, or security enhancements. We have also checked the `zcash` source code. Results show that these issues and their PRs are not backported yet. Henceforth, we suggest that `zcash` should backport the PRs listed below for the considerations of software security and integrity. 

- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#17906](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17906), avoid uninitialized reads.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#16572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16572), fix a `Char` variable used as `Bool`.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#15305](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15305), fix crash when disconnecting fail.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#15039](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15039), avoid leaking `nLockTime` fingerprint.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#14993](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993), fix data race in `InterruptRPC()`.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13808](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13808), shuffle coins before grouping, for privacy protection.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13683](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683), avoid potential null pointer dereference.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13907](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13907), avoid unlimited `locator` size in [link](https://github.com/zcash/zcash/blob/master/src/main.cpp#L6633).

Some of these issues and PRs are not severe security-related, but backports can avoid the chaos ecosystem of Bitcoin-forked projects and the potential vulnerabilities in the future. 

Reported by `de957ad9679f28a38f02f00cc7928bce8fb424882ff060a3c09c32895b1474cc`.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: I-dos
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to Denial-of-Service.

labels.name: I-race
labels.description: Problems and improvements related to race conditions.

issue.title: Backports from Bitcoin
issue.body:
We recently investigated the Bitcoin issues which are related to privacy protection, vulnerability patches, or security enhancements. We have also checked the `Ravencoin` source code. Results show that these issues and their PRs are not backported yet. Henceforth, we suggest that `Ravencoin` should backport the PRs listed below for the considerations of software security and integrity. 

- [x] Bitcoin [PR#17906](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17906), avoid uninitialized reads.
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#16572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16572), fix a `Char` variable used as `Bool`.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#16251](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16251), improve `signrawtransacAtion` error reporting.
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#15305](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15305), fix crash when disconnecting fail.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#15039](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15039), avoid leaking `nLockTime` fingerprint.
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#14993](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993), fix data race in `InterruptRPC()`.
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#14728](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14728), fix uninitialized read.
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#13907](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13907), introduce a maximum size for locators.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13808](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13808), shuffle coins before grouping, for privacy protection.
- [ ] <s> Bitcoin [PR#13683](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683), avoid potential null pointer dereference.</s>

Some of these issues and PRs are not severe security-related, but backports can avoid the chaos ecosystem of Bitcoin-forked projects and the potential vulnerabilities in the future. 

Reported by `de957ad9679f28a38f02f00cc7928bce8fb424882ff060a3c09c32895b1474cc`.

issue.title: [Backport] Backports from Bitcoin
issue.body:
We recently investigated the Bitcoin issues which are related to privacy protection, vulnerability patches, or security enhancements. We have also checked the `dgecoin` source code. Results show that these issues and their PRs are not backported yet. Henceforth, we suggest that `dogecoin` should backport the PRs listed below for the considerations of software security and integrity. 

- [x] Bitcoin [PR#17906](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17906), avoid uninitialized reads - #2759
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#16572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16572), fix a `Char` variable used as `Bool` - #2765
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#16251](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16251), improve `signrawtransacAtion` error reporting.
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#15305](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15305), fix crash when disconnecting fail. - #2767
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#15039](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15039), avoid leaking `nLockTime` fingerprint. - #2756
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#14993](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993), fix data race in `InterruptRPC()` - #2755
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#14728](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14728), fix uninitialized read - #2757
- [x] Bitcoin [PR#13907](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13907), introduce a maximum size for locators - #2758
- [ ] Bitcoin [PR#13808](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13808), shuffle coins before grouping, for privacy protection.
- ~~Bitcoin [PR#13683](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683), avoid potential null pointer dereference.~~

Some of these issues and PRs are not severe security-related, but backports can avoid the chaos ecosystem of Bitcoin-forked projects and the potential vulnerabilities in the future. 

Reported by `de957ad9679f28a38f02f00cc7928bce8fb424882ff060a3c09c32895b1474cc`.

comments.body: If `cache` is set then `cache_used` is also set. Maybe `assert(cache_used)` instead?
